sources.full: Jackalope: The Magical Adventures of the Jackalope Brigade

items.name: Skill Proficiencies
items.entry: {@skill Athletics}, {@skill Intimidation}

items.name: Tool Proficiencies
items.entry: One type of {@item gaming set|phb}

items.name: Languages
items.entry: One of your choice

items.name: Equipment
items.entry: A ceremonial circlet or diadem (A mark of your ascension to Amazon), a set of {@item common clothes|phb}, and a belt pouch containing 15gp

entries.name: Restriction: Female Only
entries: Only women can become Amazons, men are exiled or slaughtered once they have fulfilled their purpose.

entries.name: Feature: Amazon Pride
entries: Amazons are well revered warriors. Whether you are loved or feared, you find that people are often willing to be more lenient with prices and services.
Provided you are still welcome with the Amazons, you can expect free lodging and food for you and your companions within Amazon camps, so long as the men don't stay too long.

entries.name: Reason For Leaving
entries: You have been separated from your tribe for some reason. You can roll on the table to determine why, or chose one that best fits your character.

rows: I was sent on a special mission by my queen, one only I could complete.
I was captured and later escaped, I am trying to find my tribe again.
I was shunned and exiled for refusing to kill/leave my mate/son.
The tribe brings back painful memories, I had to leave.
I am searching for artefacts and allies to help my tribe.
I disagreed with the tribe and decided to go my own way.
I am the only surviving member of my tribe, I am searching for other Amazon tribes.
I simply wanted to explore the world.
I speak down to all men as if they are animals.
I only know war and wilderness, social etiquette and commerce are alien to me.
I am constantly looking for a fight to prove myself to strangers.
The sight of people living ordinary lives amuses me for some reason.
I am always ready for battle, I don't have time for bathing or looking nice.
I don't like subterfuge, I will not lie and hate when others lie.
The simplest, most direct method is usually the best.
I like to scare companions with stories from my life with the tribe.
I only value strength, I care not for morals or wisdom. (Evil)
I must follow the customs and laws of my tribe, even if I don't like it. (Lawful)
I must use what strength I have to serve the greater good. (Good)
I refuse to follow orders I disapprove of. (Chaotic)
An honourable enemy can always become a good friend. (Neutral)
Ambition, I will be more than just another woman, I will be legendary. (Any)
I serve my queen, I have no other loyalties.
I will serve Ares to my dying breath.
My honour is my life.
No man shall ever rule me.
My tribe is wrong about men, I shall never shun/execute an innocent man.
I fight for those who cannot fight for themselves.
I have little respect for anyone who is not a proven warrior.
To surrender in battle is the greatest shame I can feel.
I made a terrible mistake in battle that cost many lives-and I would do anything to keep that mistake secret.
My hatred of my enemies is blinding and unreasoning.
I obey my queen, even when I disagree with the order.
I refuse to follow the laws of the lands beyond my tribe, this constantly gets me in trouble.

entries: You hail from a famous tribe of warrior women known as the Amazons. Amazons pride themselves on their strength and independence. Men are not permitted among their ranks and are only used for breeding.

Some tribes have agreements with neighbouring tribes and settlements in which, once a year the strongest men are chosen to mate with the Amazons. Any girls born from this union are raised as Amazons themselves while the boys are sent back to their fathers.
In more aggressive tribes, men are captured during raids, enslaved and then slaughtered after the deed is done. Any boys resulting from these unions are usually killed or abandoned.

items.name: Skill Proficiencies
items.entry: Choose two from {@skill Athletics}, {@skill Animal Handling}, {@skill insight} and {@skill Survival}

items.name: Tool Proficiencies
items.entry: One type of {@item artisan's tools|phb}

items.name: Languages
items.entry: One of your choice

items.name: Equipment
items.entry: A collar or set of manacles, a set of {@item common clothes|phb}, and a belt pouch containing 5gp

entries.name: Feature: Hard Knock Life
entries: You are used to living with great difficulty and can survive with next to nothing. You can survive on half the amount of food and water as others.
In addition, when in a settlement larger than a village, you can believably pose as a beggar or pauper to elicit sympathy and get enough food or coppers to live a squalid life at no expense.

entries.name: Thrall Status
entries: You can roll on the table to determine your current status, or chose one that best fits your character.

rows: I am still a thrall in service to a master.
I have escaped my bonds and am now free.
I was rescued from my old masters by someone else.
I was granted my freedom by my old masters.

entries.name: Suggested Characteristics
entries: As a thrall you are, or were, expected to be submissive and quiet as you carried out your chores and errands without complaint. Some thralls accept this fate while others are more rebelious and openly despise their masters.

rows: I am submissive and often hesitant to complain, make eye contact or speak out of turn.
I call everyone 'sir' or 'lady' without really thinking about it.
I automatically start doing chores like cleaning out of habit.
I am terrified of ropes, chains and whips.
I look out for my friends and allies.
I am rebellious and hate being told what to do.
I want to prove my strength by subjugating my own thralls. (Evil)
People should respect and obey their betters. (Lawful)
Thralldom is a cruel tradition that should not exist. (Good)
No one should have authority over others. (Chaotic)
I just want to leave my past behind and lead my own life. (Neutral)
I want to make something of my life, I will be a somebody. (Any)
I want revenge on those who hold/held me in bondage, at any cost.
Despite everything, I still feel a sense of loyalty to my masters.
I owe everything to those who freed me.
I am my own master now, I owe nothing to anyone.
I feel a kinship with anyone who has suffered as a thrall and wish to help them however I can.
I long to return to my old life and family before I became a thrall, or at least whatever is left of them.
The cruelty of my masters has made me nervous and shy in social situations.
I tend to go along with others unquestioningly, even when I disagree with them.
I value my own life as lesser and more expendable than those around me.
I have a habit of stealing food as I fear I'll go hungry otherwise.
I am overly protective of my belongings and refuse to share, even with close friends.
I distrust people as I fear everyone I meet is secretly trying to make me their own thrall.

entries: You are, or were, a thrall to a particular individual or clan in the Northlands. Thralls are the lowest sapient beings on the social ladder, they are the slaves and serfs of the clan.

Most thralls are basic labourers such as farmers, miners and haulers. A few are put into service as house servants, concubines and cooks. Especially strong and loyal thralls may end up as housecarls, bodyguards and even raiders in their own right.
Sometimes entire hamlets and villages are held as thralls to a nearby clan under threat of raiding. Though particular individuals may also be seized and taken home to serve as personal thralls.

Even under the kindest masters, the life of a thrall is hard. You have, or had, no freedom or possessions and had to make do with whatever food and clothing your masters allow. You are, or were, expected to serve without complaint with your life as the only reward.

deity.name: Chaos
deity.title: The Original Entity
entries: Chaos was the first entity to exist, they are older than the cosmos itself. To worship Chaos is to worship absence and nothingness. Chaos does not grant any boons or rewards for worship.

customProperties.Typical Forms: Aasimar, Currently Incorporeal in the pit of Tartarus
Triton, Water Elemental, Merman, Giant Crab

deity.name: Prometheus
deity.title: Father of Humans
deity.province: Creator of Humans, Dwarves, Elves and Orcs

customProperties.Typical Forms: Elf, Aasimar, Manifestation of viewer's desires

deity.name: Apollo
deity.title: Lord of Music
deity.province: Music, Lyre, Poetry, Archery, The Sun, Prophecies and Oracles

customProperties.Worshipers: Bards, Poets, Oracles, Fortune Tellers, Archers, Temples

deity.name: Athena
deity.title: Lady of Wisdom
deity.province: Wisdom, Martial Strategy, Politics and Elves

customProperties.Worshipers: Warriors, Amazons, Generals, Politicians, Scholars, Elves
Performers, Whore, Hedonists, Innkeepers, Vineyards, Temples
Smiths, Tinkers, Firewielders, Dwarves, Warforged, Temples

deity.name: Hera
deity.title: Lady of Marriage
deity.province: Women, Marriage, Family, Punishing Adulterers and Bigamists

deity.name: Hermes
deity.title: Lord of Messengers
deity.province: Thieves, Messengers, Travellers, Shepherds, Medicine, Psychopomp for Great Heroes

customProperties.Worshipers: Thieves, Messengers, Travellers, Shepherds, Physicians, Temples

deity.name: Zeus
deity.title: Lord of the Sky
deity.province: King of Olympians, The Sky, Lighting, Xenia, Kings

customProperties.Worshipers: Undertakers, Graveyard Keepers, Necromancers, Temples, Cultists, Assassins
Mages, Scholars of Magic, Some Temples

deity.name: Thanatos
deity.title: The Soul Guide
deity.province: Personification of Death, Psychopomp for dead souls

deity.name: Rexus
deity.title: The Dragon King
entries: Rexus is the leader of the Iuris Legion.

deity.name: Sophus
deity.title: The Scholar
deity.province: Knowledge, wisdom, art and divine punishment through magic, curses and madness

deity.name: Idex
deity.title: The Judge
deity.province: Justice and divine punishment through execution, imprisonment and violence

deity.name: Ferrarius
deity.title: The Smith
deity.province: Forging, masonry, engineering, constructs and divine punishment through fire and explosions

deity.name: Pestas
deity.title: The Storm
deity.province: Storms, the fog and divine punishment through extreme weather and natural disasters
entries: Supposedly sent the fog to punish mortals on the orders of Rexus.

deity.name: Vitas
deity.title: The Protector
entries: Saved a small number of mortals from the fog to start anew.

deity.name: Ricola
deity.title: The Alchemist
deity.province: Alchemy, chemistry and divine punishment through disease and poison

deity.name: Scurra
deity.title: The Jester
deity.province: Cunning, espionage, theatre, comedy and divine punishment through ridicule and defamation
entries: While sometimes considered the “black sheep” of the Legion, some claim it was Scurra who discovered how to ascend to godhood, granting her a place within the Legion.

deity.name: Mutter
deity.title: The Mother
deity.province: The natural world (Debauchery in Caligos Imperium)
entries: The Mother is vast network of ever expanding roots that form the world itself.

deity.name: Vater
deity.title: The Father
deity.province: Life, family and the sky (Tyranny in Caligos Imperium)
entries: Vater was a rogue root of Mutter that grew upwards and outwards to form the braches that make up the sky. From these branches came life.

deity.name: Wasserie
deity.title: The River, Aspect of Mutter
deity.province: Water and uncertainty (Anarchy in Caligos Imperium)

deity.name: Geierin
deity.title: The Night, Aspect of Mutter
deity.province: Night, magic and curses (Dark magic in Caligos Imperium)

customProperties.Typical Forms: The Moon, Giant Spider, Giant Moth

deity.name: Feus
deity.title: The Warm Winds, Aspect of Mutter
deity.province: Day, warmth and fire (Droughts and arson in Caligos Imperium)

deity.name: Eiskel
deity.title: The Cold Winds, Aspect of Mutter
deity.province: Cold winds, snow and ice (Apocalypse in Caligos Imperium)

deity.name: Maulich
deity.title: The Elk, Aspect of Vater
deity.province: Prey, plantlife and agriculture (Weakness and sloth in Caligos Imperium)

deity.name: Olfus
deity.title: The Wolf, Aspect of Vater
deity.province: Predators, hunting and strengh of the pack (Violence and savagry in Caligos Imperium)

deity.name: Zornlich
deity.title: The Bull, Aspect of Vater
deity.province: Fury, passion, determination and music (Brutality and destruction in Caligos Imperium)

deity.name: Sepulcrus
deity.title: The Hare, Aspect of Vater
deity.province: Death and the afterlife (Necromancy and infernals in Caligos Imperium)

deity.name: Talitus
deity.title: The Entropic Entity
deity.province: Time, entropy and mortality (Chaos and pure evil in Caligos Imperium)
entries: Talitus does not directly belong to either the Anarchium or the Iuris Legion. They are the god of time, entropy and death. They represent the inevitable end of everything, even the gods.

There are no statues or temples of Talitus as they have no known form or gender, nor are they known to speak to mortals. Very rarely, Talitus will choose a mortal to perform a task, the purposes of these tasks are known only to Talitus.

Somewhat paradoxically, Talitus is perpetually the youngest and oldest entity in the universe. Taltius may be one, many or even none. Scholar’s have spent centuries trying to understand the very few clues they have about Talitus.

Talitus worship is deeply taboo across the entire Caligos Archipelago. Worshipping them is seen as praying for the death of everything, including the gods. In the Caligos Imperium, any evidence implying worship of Talitus is an instant death sentence.

feat.name: Daedalian Tinkerer
entries: You are a talented craftsman, able to create contraptions beyond common understanding, you gain the following benefits:

items: You learn two artificer infusions from the Artificer Infusions section at the end of the class's description. Whenever you finish a long rest, you can touch a nonmagical object and imbue it with one of your artificer infusions, turning it into a magic item as per the Infuse Item rules on page 54 of Eberron: Rising from the Last War, however you can only infuse one object at a time.
Alternatively, if you already have at least two levels in the Artificer class, you learn two additional infusions of your choice and can infuse one additional item at a time.

feat.name: Hoplite
entries: You adopt the fighting style of the hoplite, with {@item spear|phb} and {@item shield|phb}. You gain the following benefits:

items: When using a {@item spear|phb} in one hand and a {@item shield|phb} in the other, the weapon's damage die changes as if you wielded the weapon in two hands, from a {@dice d6} to a {@dice d8}. (This benefit has no effect if another feature has already improved the weapon's die.)
Attacking at long range doesn't impose disadvantage on your thrown weapon attack rolls with spears.
When an ally within 5 feet of you is attacked, you can use your reaction to grant them a +2 bonus to AC against the triggering attack. You must be wielding a {@item shield|phb} to use this feature.

feat.name: Oceanid Warrior
entries: You learn the fighting style of the Oceanids. You gain the following benefits:

items: When you wield a {@item trident|phb} or {@item bident|cyranos}, its damage die changes from a {@dice d6} to a {@dice d8} when wielded in one hand, and from a {@dice d8} to a {@dice d10} when wielded with two hands. (This benefit has no effect if another feature has already improved the weapon's die.)
When you make a melee attack with a {@item trident|phb} or {@item bident|cyranos} against a creature while either of you are underwater, you gain advantage on the attack roll.
Your reach with {@item trident|phb|tridents} or {@item bident|cyranos|bidents} with which you are proficient is increased by 5 feet.

feat.name: Pit Fighter
entries: You have adopted a flashly fighting style that always goes down well with the arena crowds. You gain the following benefits:

items: When you make a weapon attack against a creature, you can use your bonus action gain a bonus to the attack and damage rolls equal to your Charisma modifier. You can use this feature a number of times equal to your Charisma modifier (minimum of once). You regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

feat.name: Blood Mage Initiate
entries: You can harness the power of your own blood to enhance your spells. You gain the following benefits:

items: When you cast a spell that restores hit points or deals damage, you can roll {@dice 2d4} and add the number rolled as a bonus to the hit points regained or the damage dealt. You take necrotic damage equal to the number rolled, which can't be reduced in any way.

When you finish a short rest, you can choose to recover expended spell slots. None of the slots can be 6th level or higher and you take necrotic damage equal to five times the combined level of the spell slots, which can't be reduced in any way.

feat.name: Throwing Weapon Master
entries: You have mastered the art of throwing weapons. You gain the following benefits:

items: Attacking at long range doesn't impose disadvantage on your ranged weapon attack rolls when using a weapon with the thrown property.
You can add your proficiency bonus to any ranged weapon attack rolls when using a weapon with the thrown property even if you are not normally proficient with that weapon.
Being within 5 feet of a hostile creature doesn't impose disadvantage on your ranged weapon attacks when using a weapon with the thrown property.

item.name: Satyr's Wine
entries: This sweet wine is made by satyrs from forest fruits grown by dryads. When you drink this wine, you must make a DC 10 Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, you become {@condition charmed} by all creatures that you can see of any species and gender you are normally attracted to. You can repeat the saving throw at the end of every hour until you succeed and are no longer {@condition charmed}.

item.name: Hourglass of Kronos
entries: This finely crafted hourglass holds one minute of sand and bears an engraving of a scythe on one side.
The hourglass has 2 charges and regains {@dice 1d3-1} charges daily at dawn.

While holding it, you can use an action to expend 1 or more of its charges to cast the {@spell time stasis|jackalope} spell (save DC 12) from it. For 1 charge, you cast the 3rd-level version of the spell. You can increase the spell slot level by one for each additional charge you expend.

item.name: Orb of Helios and Selene
entries: This tiny glass orb sheds dim light in a 5-foot radius and shows an image of the sun, during the day, or the moon, during the night.
While holding this orb, you can use an action to read the image and determine whether it is morning, afternoon, evening, or nighttime outside. This property functions only on the Material Plane.

item.name: Sandals of the Styx
entries: These sandals have supposedly been dipped in the river styx at the border of the underworld and thus grant the wearer the powers of Achilles.
While wearing these sandals all non-magical weapon attacks against you have disadvantage.

entries.name: Curse
entries: These sandals are cursed. Attuning to it curses you until you are targeted by a spell such as {@spell remove curse} or a similar effect. While cursed, your attunement to the object cannot be broken, and any successful weapon attacks against you are treated as critical hits.

item.name: Bellerophon's Horn
entries: Once attuned to the horn you can blow it to summon a {@creature pegasus|mm}.
The pegasus is friendly to you and your companions. It understands your languages and obeys your spoken commands. If you issue no commands, the pegasus defends itself but takes no other actions.

When the pegasus drops to 0 hit points, it disappears in a cloud of mist, leaving behind no physical form, and cannot be summoned again until dawn the next dawn. You can also dismiss the pegasus at any time as an action, causing it to disappear in the same way.

item.name: Sandals of Atalanta
entries: While you are attuned to and wearing these sandals your walking speed increases by 10ft.

item.name: Wings of Daedalus
entries: While you are attuned to and wearing these wings you gain a flying speed of 30ft.

These wings require both arms to operate and so you cannot use your arms or hands whilst flying or hovering. Whilst on the ground, you can remove your arms from the contraption and use them normally while the wings hang uselessly off your back.

item.name: Helm of Darkness
entries: The helm has 3 charges and regains {@dice 1d4-1} charges daily at dawn.
As an action, you can expend one charge to cast {@spell greater invisibility|phb} on yourself.

item.name: Nemean Lion Pelt
entries: You have resistance to non-magical piercing and slashing damage while wearing this pelt.
This pelt cannot be worn over medium or heavy armor.

item.name: Spear of Kelphalos
entries: This weapon has 3 charges and regains {@dice 1d4-1} charges daily at dawn. When you miss a thrown attack with this weapon you can expend one charge to hit instead, this hit cannot be a critical hit.

item.name: Fire Retardant Ship Coating
entries: This thick, black paint can coat up to 10ft of a ship's hull exterior. Once a ship's hull exterior has been entirely coated, it is no longer vulnerable to fire damage.

item.name: Pocket Sand
entries: This fine sand or grit can be used to impede the vision of your foes.

As an action, pocket sand can be thrown at a creature with exposed eyes that is within 10ft of you. The creature must make a DC 10 Dexterity saving throw or become {@condition blinded|phb} until the begining of its next turn.

item.name: Hippolyta's Girdle
entries: While wearing this belt, your Strength score changes to 21. The item has no effect on you if your Strength without the belt is equal to or greater than the belt's score.

item.name: Bolt of Zeus
entries: Crafted by the cyclopes, this crackling, golden bolt holds the power of zeus

This item has {@dice 3d4} charges when it is found. While holding it, you can use an action to expend 1 or more of its charges to cast the {@spell lightning bolt|phb} spell (save DC 15) from it. For 1 charge, you cast the 3rd-level version of the spell. You can increase the spell slot level by one for each additional charge you expend.

If you expend the bolt's last charge roll a d20. On a 1, the bolt explodes and deals {@dice 8d6} lightning damage to all creatures within 10ft. If the roll is not a 1, the bolt crumbles into ashes and is destroyed.

item.name: Necklace of Beards
entries: While wearing this necklace a creature's beard grows by half an inch after each long rest, even if they could not normally grow a beard.

item.name: Ring of Theatrics
entries: While wearing this ring, you can cast {@spell thaumaturgy|phb} as an action.

item.name: Ring of Tricks
entries: While wearing this ring, you can cast {@spell prestidigitation|phb} as an action.

item.name: Gloves of the Gardener
entries: While wearing these gloves, you can cast {@spell druidcraft|phb} as an action.

item.name: Shield Strap
entries: This leather strap can be used to hang a {@item shield|phb} from your shoulder, hanging over your arm and flank, allowing you to keep both hands free while still gaining its usual AC bonus. The shield does limit your mobility however, giving you a -5 penalty to Dexterity checks and saving throws as well as to attack rolls whilst wearing it in this fashion.
If a feature or action requires you to be holding a shield, such as using it as a spellcasting focus, you cannot use the shield for this while it is slung.
While wearing a shield like this, you can use a bonus action to grab the shield with a free hand and use it as normal.

item.name: Buckler
entries: This small shield is made from wood or metal and is strapped to the forearm, leaving the hand free. Wielding a buckler increases your Armor Class by 1. You can benefit from only one shield or buckler at a time. You cannot use weapons with the two handed property while wielding this buckler.

item.name: Wheellock Pistol
entries: This firearm uses a friction wheel to ignite its powder. The delicacy of this design means it can't handle as much powder, making it weaker than modern designs.

item.name: Wheellock Musket
entries: This firearm uses a friction wheel to ignite its powder. The delicacy of this design means it can't handle as much powder, making it weaker than modern designs.

item.name: Flintlock Pistol
entries: This firearm uses a flint striker to ignite its powder. This is the most common design for modern firearms.

item.name: Flintlock Musket
entries: This firearm uses a flint striker to ignite its powder. This is the most common design for modern firearms.

item.name: Pepperbox Pistol
entries: Multi-Barrel. When you use the {@action Attack} action and attack with this weapon, you can use a bonus action to make an additional attack with this weapon. This addtional attack ignores the loading property of this weapon.

item.name: Pepperbox Musket
entries: Multi-Barrel. When you use the {@action Attack} action and attack with this weapon, you can use a bonus action to make an additional attack with this weapon. This addtional attack ignores the loading property of this weapon.

item.name: Duckfoot Pistol
entries: This advanced firearm design features several barrels placed at different angles alongside each other, resembling a duck's foot. When the trigger is pulled, all barrels fire simultaneously casting a wide arc of bullets.

Wide-Shot. When you make an attack with this weapon, you do not target a single creature. Instead every creature within a 15ft cone originating from the weapon must make a DC 12 Dexterity saving throw. A target takes this weapons damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. This action uses five pieces of ammunition.

item.name: Blunderbuss
entries: This advanced firearm design features a wide flared barrel in which multiple bullets can fit. When the trigger is pulled, all bullets are fired simultaneously.

Improvised-Ammunition. This weapon can be loaded with any ten tiny objects, such as gravel or ball bearings. When you do so, any creature targeted by an attack from this weapon has advantage on the saving throw to avoid being hit. The damage for this kind of attack is 1d4.

Wide-Shot. When you make an attack with this weapon, you do not target a single creature. Instead every creature within a 30ft cone originating from the weapon must make a DC 12 Dexterity saving throw. A target takes this weapons damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. This action uses ten pieces of ammunition.

item.name: Legionsbane Pistol
entries: You have a +2 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon.
This weapon superheats bullets it fires, dealing an extra {@dice 2d6} fire damage on a hit.

Multi-Barrel. When you use the {@action Attack} action and attack with this weapon, you can use a bonus action to make an additional attack with this weapon. This addtional attack ignores the loading property of this weapon.

item.name: Inquisitor Mask
entries: This leather and metal mask features goggles and a beak. While wearing this mask, you are immune to the {@condition blinded|phb} condition.

item.name: Firearm Scope
entries: This set of carefully crafted lenses makes aiming at long range easier. You can spend 10 minutes afixing this scope to a firearm with the Two-Handed property , after which attacking at long range doesn't impose disadvantage on your ranged weapon attack rolls with this weapon. This does not have any effect on firearms with the Wide-Shot property.

item.name: Homing Ink Tattoo
entries: Produced by a special needle, this magic tattoo features a series of runic sigils. Each sigil corresponds to a particular teleportation circle that you know. Whenever you commit a circle's sigil to memory, the sigil is added to the design of this tattoo.

You can use this tattoo to cast the {@spell teleportation circle} spell without expending a spell slot (you must still provide the material components). Once you use this feature, you cannot do so again until the next dawn.

item.name: Arcane Ink Tattoo
entries: Produced by a special needle, this magic tattoo can improve the bearer's abilities. When this tattoo is applied, increase one of your abilty scores by 1, to a maximum of 24. You can only bear one tattoo of this kind.

item.name: Xerc's Tin Foil Hat
entries: This tin foil hat is not actually magical in any way but if the wearer believes strongly enough that it is, it grants them advantage on saving throws to avoid being {@condition charmed|phb} or {@condition frightened|phb}.

item.name: Wild Magic Faggot
entries: This odd bundle of twigs from unknown, magical plants can be used in place of a wand.
This item has 3 charges and regains {@dice 1d4-1} charges daily at dawn. If you expend the wand's last charge, roll a {@dice d20}. On a 1, the wand crumbles into ashes and is destroyed.
When you use this wand to cast a spell of 1st level or higher, you can expend any number of charges to gain a bonus to the spell's attack rolls. The bonus is equal to the number of charges expended.
Whenever charges are expended, you trigger a Wild Magic Surge.

item.name: Boots of Dramatic Hovering
entries: These boots allow you to hover dramatically up to 1 foot above the ground as a bonus action. Whilst hovering, you move as if you were walking. The boots do not grant you a flying speed or any protection from terrain, falls or traps.

item.name: Scroll of Unique Wish
entries: This scroll allows a creature to cast the {@spell wish|phb} spell. In addition to the usual drawbacks of the spell, if the creature's wish has ever been wished before, the wish fails and instead summons an {@creature avatar of death|dmg} that is hostile to the creature. The Dungeon Master decides if the wish is unique. Whether the wish suceeds or fails, the scroll burns up and can't be used again.

trait.name: Brave
entries: The Amazon Huntress has advantage on saving throws against being frightened.

trait.name: Brute
entries: A weapon deals one extra die of its damage when the Amazon Huntress hits with it (included in the attack).

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The Amazon Huntress makes two weapon attacks.

action.name: Longbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 6} to hit, range 150/600 ft., one target. {@h}14 ({@damage 2d8 + 4}) piercing damage.

action.name: Kopis
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}12 ({@damage 2d6 + 4}) slashing damage.

trait.name: Brave
entries: The Amazon Warrior has advantage on saving throws against being frightened.

trait.name: Brute
entries: A weapon deals one extra die of its damage when the Amazon Warrior hits with it (included in the attack).

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The Amazon Warrior makes two weapon attacks.

action.name: Spear
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft. and range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d6 + 4}) piercing damage, or {@h}13 ({@damage 2d8 + 4}) piercing damage if used with two hands to makes a melee attack.

action.name: Shield Bash
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 2d4 + 4}) bludgeoning damage. If the target is Medium or smaller creature, it must succeed on a DC 15 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone.

action.name: Kopis
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}12 ({@damage 2d6 + 4}) slashing damage.

reaction.name: Parry
entries: The Amazon Warrior adds 3 to its AC against one melee attack that would hit it. To do so, the Amazon Hoplite must see the attacker and be wielding a melee weapon.

trait.name: Formation Tactics
entries: The soldier has advantage on saving throws against being charmed, frightened, grappled, or restrained while it is within 5 feet of at least one ally.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The captain makes three melee attacks.

action.name: Spear
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) piercing damage, or {@h}8 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}), piercing damage if used with two hands.

action.name: Shield Bash
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d4 + 3}) blugeoning damage. If the target is a Medium or smaller creature, it must succeed on a DC 13 Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.

action.name: Kopis
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) slashing damage.

reaction.name: Shape Up Maggots
entries: Whenever a friendly creature within 30 feet of the captain that can hear it misses with an attack, the captain can yell perilous threats to allow that creature to reroll the attack roll.

trait.name: Formation Tactics
entries: The soldier has advantage on saving throws against being charmed, frightened, grappled, or restrained while it is within 5 feet of at least one ally.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The hoplite makes two melee attacks.

action.name: Spear
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) piercing damage, or {@h}7 ({@damage 1d8 + 2}), piercing damage if used with two hands.

action.name: Kopis
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) slashing damage.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The hoplite makes two attacks with its longbow or kopis.

action.name: Longbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 5} to hit, range 150/600 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) piercing damage.

action.name: Kopis
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) slashing damage.

trait.name: Warforged Resilience
entries: The warforged has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition poisoned} and is immune to disease. Magic can't put it to sleep.

trait.name: Serve the Master
entries: The warforged knows a humanoid creature as its master. The warforged must protect the master with its life, and must obey the master's every order, unless it directly threatens the life of the master.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The warforged makes two armblade attacks.

action.name: Armblade
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) slashing damage.

action.name: Javelin
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 30/120 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) piercing damage.

action.name: Protect The Master
entries: When a creature makes an attack roll against the warforged's master and the warforged is able to reach them using their remaining movement, the warforged can use their reaction and their movement to block the incoming attack, taking the hit (or miss) themselves. The warforged's AC is used to determine if the attack hits or misses.

action.name: Final Protocol
entries: When all hope is lost, the warforged can perform one final act to hinder their enemies. The warforged can overload their core to explode.

Each creature in a 20-foot-radius sphere centered on the warforged must make a DC12 Dexterity saving throw. A target takes 8d6 lightning damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.
This action kills the warforged and shatters their body into a thousand pieces.

reaction.name: Protection
entries: When an attacker the warforged can see makes an attack roll against a creature within 5 feet of the warforged, the warforged can impose disadvantage on the attack roll.

monster.name: Warforged Horse
languages: understands Common but can't speak it

trait.name: Warforged Resilience
enteries: The warforged has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition poisoned|phb} and is immune to disease. Magic can't put it to sleep.

trait.name: Trampling Charge
entries: If the horse moves at least 20 feet straight toward a creature and then hits it with a hooves attack on the same turn, that target must succeed on a DC 15 Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone|phb}. If the target is {@condition prone|phb}, the horse can make another attack with its hooves against it as a bonus action.

action.name: Hooves
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d6 + 4}) blugeoning damage.

monster.name: Warforged Boar
languages: understands Common but can't speak it

trait.name: Warforged Resilience
enteries: The warforged has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition poisoned|phb} and is immune to disease. Magic can't put it to sleep.

trait.name: Charge
entries: If the boar moves at least 20 feet straight toward a target and then hits it with a tusk attack on the same turn, the target takes an extra 7 ({@dice 2d6}) slashing damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a DC 13 Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone|phb}.

action.name: Tusk
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d6 + 3}) slashing damage.

monster.name: Warforged Dog
languages: understands Common but can't speak it

trait.name: Warforged Resilience
enteries: The warforged has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition poisoned|phb} and is immune to disease. Magic can't put it to sleep.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 3} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 2d6 + 2}) piercing damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a DC 12 Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone|phb}.

optionalfeature.name: Pact Gunsmith
entries: You can create a pact weapon that is a {@item wheellock pistol|caligos}, {@item wheellock musket|caligos}, {@item flintlock pistol|caligos} or {@item flintlock musket|caligos}. Additionally you can transform any magical firearm into your pact weapon.

optionalfeature.name: Doomerang
entries: You can cast the {@spell Boomerang Blade|Jackalope} cantrip at will using one of your pact weapons. When you do so the range is doubled.

entries.name: Age
entries: Dwarves mature at the same rate as humans, but they're considered young until they reach the age of 50. On average, they live about 350 years.

entries.name: Alignment
entries: Thalian dwarves tend to be neutral, prefering to dedicate to their craft rather than politics or tradition.

entries.name: Size
entries: Dwarves stand between 4 and 5 feet tall and average about 150 pounds. Your size is Medium.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read, and write Common and Dwarvish. When carved or written, Dwarvish appears as rows of horizontal and vertical fletched lines. Dwarves often use clay tablets to tally payments, account for shipments of ore, or send messages. It can be etched on leaves of copper and gold as a prayer to the gods.These metal scrolls are then melted into the bronze of swords or armor, believed to imbue them with the words of the smith.

entries.name: Darkvision
entries: Accustomed to life underground, you have superior vision in dark and dim conditions. You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.

entries.name: Thalian Resilience
entries: You have advantage on saving throws against poison, and you have resistance against poison and fire damage.

entries.name: Dwarven Combat Training
entries: You have proficiency with the {@item battleaxe|phb}, {@item handaxe|phb}, {@item light hammer|phb}, and {@item warhammer|phb}.

entries.name: Tool Proficiency
entries: You gain proficiency with the artisan's tools of your choice: {@item smith's tools|phb}, {@item brewer's supplies|phb}, or {@item mason's tools|phb}.

entries.name: Stonecunning
entries: Whenever you make an Intelligence ({@skill History}) check related to the origin of stonework, such as ancient columns or statues, you are considered proficient in the {@skill History} skill and add double your proficiency bonus to the check instead of your normal proficiency bonus.

entries.name: Age
entries: Fenri typically mature around 8 years of age. Fenri rarely live beyond 50 years of age.

entries.name: Alignment
entries: Fenri tend to be loyal, good boys and girls, tending towards neutral good alignments. However some rebellious and malicious Fenri do exist.

entries.name: Size
entries: Fenri come in many breeds and vary greatly in size, they typically stand between 4 and 7 feet tall and weigh between 150 and 240 lbs. Your size is medium.

entries.name: Speed
entries: Your base walking speed is 30 feet.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read, and write Common and one other language of your choice.

entries.name: Canine Senses
entries: You have advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on hearing or smell.

entries.name: Furry Fiend
entries: You have advantage on Intimidation (Charisma) checks against Tabaxi.

entries.name: Menacing
entries: You gain proficiency in the {@skill Intimidation} skill.

entries.name: Aggressive
entries: As a bonus action, you can move up to your movement speed toward a hostile creature you can see or hear. You must end this move closer to the enemy than you started.

entries.name: Powerful Build
entries: You count as one size larger when determining your carrying capacity and the weight you can push, drag, or lift.

entries.name: Hunter's Grip
entries: When a creature you have grappled attempts to break free, you can use your reaction to sink your teeth into them and gain advantage on the contested roll.

entries.name: All Fours.
entries: You can take the dash action as bonus action, when you do so, you run on all fours.

entries.name: Darkvision
entries: Your connection to the afterlife grants you sight in darkness. You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern colour in darkness, only shades of gray.

entries.name: The Scales
entries: If you are reduced to 0 hitpoints, you can use your reaction to immediately roll a deathsave. On a success, you can expend one hitdie to regain hitpoints and stay conscious. On a failure, you immediately fail one deathsave. Once you use this trait, you can't use it again until you finish a long rest.

entries.name: Darkvision
entries: You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern colour in darkness, only shades of gray.

entries.name: Deductive Intuition
entries: When you make an Intelligence (Investigation) or a Wisdom (Insight) check, you can roll a {@dice d4} and add the number rolled to the ability check.

entries.name: Sniff 'Em Out
entries: You can cast the {@spell detect evil and good|phb} and {@spell detect poison and disease|phb} spells with this trait. Starting at 3rd level, you can also cast the {@spell see invisibility|phb} spell with it. Once you cast any of these spells with this trait, you can't cast that spell with it again until you finish a long rest. Wisdom is your spellcasting ability for these spells, and you don't require material components for them.

entries.name: Age
entries: Thalian Cyclopes mature at the same rate as humans, but they're considered young until they reach the age of 50. On average, they live about 350 years.

entries.name: Alignment
entries: Thalian Cyclopes tend to be neutral, prefering to dedicate to their craft rather than politics or tradition.

entries.name: Size
entries: Thalian Cyclopes are between 7 and 8 feet tall and weigh between 280 and 340 pounds. Your size is Medium.

entries.name: Speed
entries: Your base walking speed is 30 feet.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read, and write Common and one other language of your choice.

entries.name: Thalian Resilience
entries: You have resistance against fire damage.

entries.name: Tool Proficiency
entries: You gain proficiency with {@item smith's tools|phb}.

entries.name: Magic Forgemaster
entries: You can cast the {@spell identify|phb} spell as a ritual.

entries.name: Poor Depth Perception
entries: You have disadvantage on any attack roll against a target more than 30 feet away.

entries.name: Powerful Build
entries: You count as one size larger when determining your carrying capacity and the weight you can push, drag, or lift.
Deep under the mighty volcano of Thalia generations of cyclopes have laboured for thousands of years, producing some of the greatest weapons in the known world, including the thunderbolts of Zeus.

entries.name: Age
entries: A typical cannon is between two and three years old. The maximum cannon lifespans remains a mystery; so far, cannons have shown no signs of deterioration due to age. You are immune to magical aging effects.

entries.name: Alignment
entries: Most cannons take comfort in order and discipline, tending toward law and neutrality. But some have absorbed the morality, or lack thereof, of the beings with which they served.

entries.name: Size
entries: Cannons stand just over 2 feet tall and average about 20 pounds. Your size is Small.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read, and write Common. You can also speak using your Machine Speech trait.

entries.name: Machine Speech
entries: Machine Speech is a series of beeps at varying pitch and length. At the DM's discretion, certain other creatures may understand or speak this language.

entries.name: Constructed Resilience
entries: You were created to have remarkable fortitude, represented by the following benefits:

items: You have advantage on saving throws against being poisoned, and you have resistance to {@condition poison|phb} damage.
You don't need to eat, drink, or breathe.
You don't need to sleep, and magic can't put you to sleep.

entries.name: Sentry's Rest.
entries: When you take a long rest, you must spend at least six hours in an inactive, motionless state, rather than sleeping. In this state, you appear inert, but it doesn't render you {@condition unconscious|phb}, and you can see and hear as normal.

entries.name: Natural Armor.
entries: Due to your shell and the shape of your body, you are ill-suited to wearing armor. Your shell provides ample protection, however; it gives you a base AC of 17 (your Dexterity modifier doesn't affect this number). You gain no benefit from wearing armor, but if you are using a shield, you can apply the shield's bonus as normal.

entries.name: Shell Defence.
entries: You can withdraw into your shell as an action. Until you emerge, you gain a +4 bonus to AC, and you have advantage on Strength and Constitution saving throws. While in your shell, you are {@condition prone|phb}, your speed is 0 and can't increase, you have disadvantage on Dexterity saving throws, you can't take reactions, and the only action you can take is a bonus action to emerge from your shell.

entries.name: Force Ballista.
entries: If you have the Spellcasting or the Pact Magic class feature, the {@spell Tin's Force Ballista|Tin} spell is added to the spell list of your spellcasting class.

spell.name: Time Stasis
entries: This spell lets you freeze a creature or object in time. Choose a creature, of size Large or smaller, or a non-magical object, that is not greater than 10ft in any dimension, that you can see within range. If the target is a creature or is an object carried or worn by a creature, it must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or be frozen in time for the spell's duration.
While frozen, a target is {@condition incapacitated|phb}, can't move or speak, and is unaware of its surroundings. It is also unaffected by any external forces such as gravity, attacks and spells.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, you can affect one additional creature or object for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Tin's Force Ballista
entries: You fire a small dart of magically compressed matter at a creature or object within range. Make a ranged spell attack against the target. On a hit, the target takes {@dice 1d8} force damage. The target must succeed on a Strength saving throw or be pushed up to 5 feet in a straight line away from you.
This spell's damage increases by {@dice 1d8} when you reach 5th level ({@dice 2d8}), 11th level ({@dice 3d8}), and 17th level ({@dice 4d8}).

spell.name: Boomerang Blade

components.m: a melee weapon that does not have the Heavy property.

entries: You magically launch the weapon used in the spell's casting at one creature you can see within range. Make a ranged spell attack. On a hit, the target suffers the weapon attack's normal effects, plus an extra {@dice 1d4} force damage. Hit or miss the weapon then returns to your hand.
This spell's damage increases by {@dice 1d4} when you reach 5th level ({@dice 2d4}), 11th level ({@dice 3d4}), and 17th level ({@dice 4d4}).

subclassFeature.name: Time Domain
entries: The forces of time and entropy are some of the most powerful in the universe. Eventually time will consume everything, even the universe itself. The gods and goddesses who control the flow of time, such as Kronos or Talitus control the lives, deaths and fate of every being in existence. Followers of these deities can employ chronomancy to alter their fate and that of their allies.
At each indicated cleric level, you add the listed spells to your spells prepared.

entries.caption: Time Domain Spells
rows: 1st
{@spell gift of alacrity|egw}, {@spell feather fall|phb}
3rd
{@spell immovable object|egw}, {@spell hold person|phb}
5th
{@spell slow|phb}, {@spell haste|phb}
7th
{@spell dimension door|phb}, {@spell freedom of movement|phb}
9th
{@spell far step|xge}, {@spell temporal shunt|egw}

subclassFeature.name: Optional Rule: Time Stasis
entries: If your Dungeon Master allows, you can replace either the {@spell slow|PHB} or {@spell haste|PHB} spell in your time domain spells with the {@spell Time Stasis|Jackalope} spell.

subclassFeature.name: Temporal Control
entries: Starting when you choose this domain at 1st level, you have advantage on your initiative rolls, provided you are not {@condition incapacitated}.

subclassFeature.name: Channel Divinity: Rewrite History
entries: Starting at 2nd level, you can use your Channel Divinity to rewrite a single moment in time.

When you or a creature you can see within 30ft of you rolls damage or healing, you can use your channel divinity as a reaction to force them to reroll a single die of your choice, they must then take the result of the new roll.

subclassFeature.name: Quickened Evasion
entries: At 6th level, you can control the flow of time to improve evasive capabilities for you or your allies. When you or a creature within 30ft of you is targeted by an attack roll or makes a Dexterity saving throw, you can use your reaction to add your wisdom modifier to the creature’s AC or saving throw. You can choose to use this feature after the die is rolled, but before the outcome is determined.
You can use this feature a number of times equal to your Wisdom modifier (minimum of once), and you regain all expended uses of it when you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Potent Spellcasting
entries: Starting at 8th level, you add your Wisdom modifier to the damage you deal with any {@class cleric|phb} cantrip.

subclassFeature.name: Blessed Strikes
entries: 8th-level cleric {@variantrule optional class features|tce|optional feature}, which replaces the Potent Spellcasting feature

You are blessed with divine might in battle. When a creature takes damage from one of your cantrips or weapon attacks, you can also deal {@dice 1d8} radiant damage to that creature. Once you deal this damage, you can't use this feature again until the start of your next turn.

subclassFeature.name: Temporal Halt
entries: At 17th level, you learn the {@spell Time Stop} spell as a cleric spell, it does not count towards your prepared spells. When you cast it as a cleric spell you can target one additional creature to be unaffected by the spell, allowing them to also use actions and move as normal for the duration of the spell. The spell ends for both of you if either of you perform any action that would end the spell for you, as described in the spell’s description.

subclassFeature.name: Optional Rule: Additional Dunamancy Spells
entries: If your Dungeon Master allows, you may add the {@spell Reality Break|egw} and {@spell Time Ravage|egw} spells to your cleric spell list.

vehicle.name: Rowboat

entries: 15 ft.
Move up to its speed, with one 90-degree turn. Without oars, the rowboat's speed is 0.

action: On its turn, the rowboat can take the move action below. It can't take this action if it has no crew.

items.name: Move.
items.entry: The rowboat can move using its oars.

vehicle.name: Small Ship

control.name: Helm
entries: Move up to the speed of one of its movement components, with one 90-degree turn. If the helm is destroyed, the ship can't turn.
20 ft. (requires at least 2 crew)
25 ft.; 15 ft. while sailing into the wind; 35 ft. while sailing with the wind.

weapon.name: Ballista
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 6} to hit, range 120/480 ft., one target. {@h}16 ({@damage 3d10}) piercing damage.

Small ships typically include a ballista only when they are equipped for combat. If a small ship is equipped with a ballista, the maximum number of passengers the ship can carry is reduced by two and the cargo capacity is reduced by 200lbs.

action: On its turn, the small ship can take 2 actions, choosing from the options below. It can take only 1 action if it has fewer than four crew. It can't take these actions if it has fewer than two crew.

items.name: Fire Ballista.
items.entry: If it has at least one installed the ship can fire its {@object ballista||ballistas} (DMG, ch. 8).

items.name: Move.
items.entry: The ship can use its helm to move with its oars or sails.

vehicle.name: Medium Ship

control.name: Helm
entries: Move up to the speed of one of its movement components, with one 90-degree turn. If the helm is destroyed, the ship can't turn.
20 ft. (requires at least 15 crew)
45 ft.; 15 ft. while sailing into the wind; 60 ft. while sailing with the wind.

weapon.name: Ballista
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 6} to hit, range 120/480 ft., one target. {@h}16 ({@damage 3d10}) piercing damage.

Ships typically include a ballista only when they are equipped for combat. If a ship is equipped with a ballista, the maximum number of passengers the ship can carry is reduced by two and the cargo capacity is reduced by 200 lbs.

weapon.name: Dragonsmaw
entries: Each creature in a 30-foot long 5-foot wide line must make a DC 14 Dexterity saving throw. A creature takes {@h}20 ({@damage 5d6}) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. The fire ignites any flammable objects in the area that aren’t being worn or carried.

When a Dragonsmaw is destroyed, it explodes in a ball of fire. Each creature within 10ft of the weapon must make a DC 12 Dexterity saving throw. A creature takes {@h}20 ({@damage 5d6}) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. The fire ignites any flammable objects in the area that aren’t being worn or carried.

Ships typically include a Dragonsmaw only when they are equipped for combat. If a ship is equipped with a dragonsmaw, the maximum number of passengers the ship can carry is reduced by two and the cargo capacity is reduced by 200 lbs.

weapon.name: Mangonels
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 5} to hit, range 200/800 ft. (can't hit targets within 60 ft. of it), one target. {@h}27 ({@damage 5d10}) bludgeoning damage.

Ships typically include a mangonels only when they are equipped for combat. If a ship is equipped with a mangonel, the maximum number of passengers the ship can carry is reduced by four and the cargo capacity is reduced by 400 lbs.

weapon.name: Naval Ram
entries: The ship has advantage on all saving throws relating to crashing when it crashes into a creature or an object. Any damage it takes from the crash is applied to the naval ram rather than to the ship. These benefits don't apply if another vessel crashes into the galley.

action: On its turn, the ship can take 3 actions, choosing from the options below. It can take only 2 actions if it has fewer than thirty crew and only 1 action if it has fewer than twenty. It can't take these actions if it has fewer than ten crew.

items.name: Fire Ballista.
items.entry: If it has at least one installed the ship can fire its {@object ballista||ballistas} (DMG, ch. 8).

items.name: Fire Dragonsmaws.
items.entry: If it has at least one installed the ship can fire its Dragonsmaws

items.name: Fire Mangonels.
items.entry: If it has at least one installed the ship can fire its {@object mangonel||mangonels} (DMG, ch. 8).

items.name: Move.
items.entry: The ship can use its helm to move with its oars or sails.

vehicle.name: Large Ship

control.name: Helm
entries: Move up to the speed of one of its movement components, with one 90-degree turn. If the helm is destroyed, the ship can't turn.
20 ft. (requires at least 40 crew)
45 ft.; 15 ft. while sailing into the wind; 60 ft. while sailing with the wind.

weapon.name: Ballista
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 6} to hit, range 120/480 ft., one target. {@h}16 ({@damage 3d10}) piercing damage.

Ships typically include a ballista only when they are equipped for combat. If a ship is equipped with a ballista, the maximum number of passengers the ship can carry is reduced by two and the cargo capacity is reduced by 200 lbs.

weapon.name: Dragonsmaw
entries: Each creature in a 30-foot long 5-foot wide line must make a DC 14 Dexterity saving throw. A creature takes {@h}20 ({@damage 5d6}) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. The fire ignites any flammable objects in the area that aren’t being worn or carried.

When a Dragonsmaw is destroyed, it explodes in a ball of fire. Each creature within 10ft of the weapon must make a DC 12 Dexterity saving throw. A creature takes {@h}20 ({@damage 5d6}) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. The fire ignites any flammable objects in the area that aren’t being worn or carried.

Ships typically include a Dragonsmaw only when they are equipped for combat. If a ship is equipped with a dragonsmaw, the maximum number of passengers the ship can carry is reduced by two and the cargo capacity is reduced by 200 lbs.

weapon.name: Mangonels
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 5} to hit, range 200/800 ft. (can't hit targets within 60 ft. of it), one target. {@h}27 ({@damage 5d10}) bludgeoning damage.

Ships typically include a mangonels only when they are equipped for combat. If a ship is equipped with a mangonel, the maximum number of passengers the ship can carry is reduced by four and the cargo capacity is reduced by 400 lbs.

weapon.name: Naval Ram
entries: The ship has advantage on all saving throws relating to crashing when it crashes into a creature or an object. Any damage it takes from the crash is applied to the naval ram rather than to the ship. These benefits don't apply if another vessel crashes into the galley.

action: On its turn, the ship can take 3 actions, choosing from the options below. It can take only 2 actions if it has fewer than eighty crew and only 1 action if it has fewer than forty. It can't take these actions if it has fewer than twenty crew.

items.name: Fire Ballista.
items.entry: If it has at least one installed the ship can fire its {@object ballista||ballistas} (DMG, ch. 8).

items.name: Fire Dragonsmaws.
items.entry: If it has at least one installed the ship can fire its Dragonsmaws

items.name: Fire Mangonels.
items.entry: If it has at least one installed the ship can fire its {@object mangonel||mangonels} (DMG, ch. 8).

items.name: Move.
items.entry: The ship can use its helm to move with its oars or sails.

vehicle.name: Flagship

control.name: Helm
entries: Move up to the speed of one of its movement components, with one 90-degree turn. If the helm is destroyed, the ship can't turn.
20 ft. (requires at least 40 crew)
50 ft.; 20 ft. while sailing into the wind; 70 ft. while sailing with the wind.

weapon.name: Ballista
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 6} to hit, range 120/480 ft., one target. {@h}16 ({@damage 3d10}) piercing damage.

Ships typically include a ballista only when they are equipped for combat. If a ship is equipped with a ballista, the maximum number of passengers the ship can carry is reduced by two and the cargo capacity is reduced by 200 lbs.

weapon.name: Dragonsmaw
entries: Each creature in a 30-foot long 5-foot wide line must make a DC 14 Dexterity saving throw. A creature takes {@h}20 ({@damage 5d6}) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. The fire ignites any flammable objects in the area that aren’t being worn or carried.

When a Dragonsmaw is destroyed, it explodes in a ball of fire. Each creature within 10ft of the weapon must make a DC 12 Dexterity saving throw. A creature takes {@h}20 ({@damage 5d6}) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. The fire ignites any flammable objects in the area that aren’t being worn or carried.

Ships typically include a Dragonsmaw only when they are equipped for combat. If a ship is equipped with a dragonsmaw, the maximum number of passengers the ship can carry is reduced by two and the cargo capacity is reduced by 200 lbs.

weapon.name: Mangonels
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 5} to hit, range 200/800 ft. (can't hit targets within 60 ft. of it), one target. {@h}27 ({@damage 5d10}) bludgeoning damage.

Ships typically include a mangonels only when they are equipped for combat. If a ship is equipped with a mangonel, the maximum number of passengers the ship can carry is reduced by four and the cargo capacity is reduced by 400 lbs.

weapon.name: Naval Ram
entries: The ship has advantage on all saving throws relating to crashing when it crashes into a creature or an object. Any damage it takes from the crash is applied to the naval ram rather than to the ship. These benefits don't apply if another vessel crashes into the galley.

action: On its turn, the ship can take 4 actions, choosing from the options below. It can take only 3 actions if it has fewer than one hundred crew, only 2 action if it has fewer than eighty crew and only 1 action if it has fewer than sixty. It can't take these actions if it has fewer than forty crew.

items.name: Fire Ballista.
items.entry: If it has at least one installed the ship can fire its {@object ballista||ballistas} (DMG, ch. 8).

items.name: Fire Dragonsmaws.
items.entry: If it has at least one installed the ship can fire its Dragonsmaws

items.name: Fire Mangonels.
items.entry: If it has at least one installed the ship can fire its {@object mangonel||mangonels} (DMG, ch. 8).

items.name: Move.
items.entry: The ship can use its helm to move with its oars or sails.

vehicle.name: Lesboat

control.name: Helm
entries: Move up to the speed of one of its movement components, with one 90-degree turn. If the helm is destroyed, the ship can't turn.
20 ft. (requires at least 2 crew)
25 ft.; 15 ft. while sailing into the wind; 35 ft. while sailing with the wind.

action: On its turn, the small ship can take 2 actions, choosing from the options below. It can take only 1 action if it has fewer than four crew. It can't take these actions if it has fewer than two crew.

items.name: Move.
items.entry: The ship can use its helm to move with its oars or sails.

entries: You have a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this ammunition, unless it is magic ammunition that already has a bonus to those rolls.
Ammunition made of or coated with adamantine is unusually effective when used to break objects. Whenever an adamantine ammunition hits an object, the hit is a critical hit.

The adamantine version of twenty pieces of ammunition costs 750 gp more than the normal version and takes at least one workweek to make, whether the ammunition is made of the metal or coated with it. Adamantine ammunition can only be made at The Forge on Thalia.
You gain a +1 bonus to AC while you wear this armor, unless it is magic armor that already has a bonus to AC.
This suit of armor is reinforced with adamantine, one of the hardest substances in existence. While you're wearing it, any critical hit against you becomes a normal hit.

The adamantine version of a set of armor costs 750 gp more than the normal version and takes at least one workweek to make, whether the armor is made of the metal or coated with it. Adamantine armor can only be made at The Forge on Thalia.
You have a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this weapon, unless it is a magic weapon that already has a bonus to those rolls.
Melee weapons made of or coated with adamantine are unusually effective when used to break objects. Whenever an adamantine weapon hits an object, the hit is a critical hit.

The adamantine version of a melee weapon costs 750 gp more than the normal version and takes at least one workweek to make, whether the weapon is made of the metal or coated with it. Adamantine weapons can only be made at The Forge on Thalia.
You have a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon.
This weapon has 3 charges and regains {@dice 1d4-1} charges daily at dawn.
When you use this weapon to kill a humanoid creature you can expend one charge to cast {@spell animate dead|phb} on that creature.
Spiral grooves on the inside of the barrel force the bullet to spin when fired, helping it travel further. An engineer or blacksmith can rifle the inside of most barrels for 150gp.
The normal and long range of a rifled firearm are both doubled.
This has no effect on firearms with the Wide-Shot property.
